intro: Clidemia verticillata, commonly known as false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia verticillata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
